page.title: 12Park Farm
page.content: Park Farm covers 340 acres. It is owned by Rockingham Estates and Mr and Mrs Champion are its tenant farmers. 40 acres are grassland and roads. Mr. Champion works in the fields on a 5 year rotation system. This year he has grown 180 acres of Wheat, 60 acres of Barley and 60 acres of Oil Seed Rape. He keeps 26 Hereford cross Friesian bullocks for fattening. The farm machinery includes two big tractors, two rollers, farm trailers, one small tractor, a drill, a bailer, power harrow, a seed harrow, forklift truck and a Landrover. There is a grain store holding 5,000 tons of grain which is sent to the Sovereign Flour Mills in Corby. Park Farm is an old farm cut out of Rockingham Forest. During the Civil War (1645) Sir Lewis Watson of Rockingham Castle was imprisoned here before he was sent to Belvoir Castle.
